title: Bush Turnpike archive photos

pageHeader.title: Archive: Driving Westbound from SH 78 in Garland to I-635 in Irving
pageHeader.subTitle: Tollway has been widened to 8 main lanes since these photos were taken
pageHeader.lastUpdated: Sept 22, 2022 (classify this page and all photos as archive)

text:
This entire section was expanded to have eight main lanes. These views show the original toll road with six main lanes. These photos were classified as archive photos in September 2022.

The widenings were opened in sections between November 2016 and October 2021.

images.caption: Entering the main lanes going westbound, just east of Highway 78

imageStatus.note: The main lanes going eastward from this location were opened in 2011.
This location was modified in 2011 when the main lanes to the east were opened.

images.caption: This short section of freeway was built by TxDOT in the late 1990s, so it is toll free. The tollway starts after this exit.

imageStatus.note: The fourth lane opened to traffic in October 2018.
The fourth lane opened to traffic in October 2018.

images.caption: Approaching the first toll plaza. There will be 3 more on this trip.

imageStatus.note: The cash lanes for paying tolls were closed when the NTTA system became all electronic.
The fourth lane opened to traffic in October 2018.
The fourth lane opened to traffic in October 2018.
The fourth lane opened to traffic in November 2016.

images.caption: Bush Turnpike is the top level of the interchange, and this is the upgrade.

imageStatus.note: The fourth lane opened to traffic in November 2016.

images.caption: On the downgrade. Richardson is on the left (south), Plano is on the right (north).

imageStatus.note: An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.
An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.
An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.
An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.

images.caption: The second toll plaza, just west of Coit

imageStatus.note: The cash lanes for paying tolls were closed when the NTTA system became all electronic.
An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.
An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.

images.caption: Approaching the Dallas North Tollway interchange

imageStatus.note: An additional lane in each direction was added in the median in November 2016.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.

images.caption: Now we are in Carrollton. The highway pavement becomes asphalt.

imageStatus.note: An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
The cash lanes for paying tolls were closed when the NTTA system became all electronic.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in December 2019.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.

images.caption: This section of the turnpike opened on September 9, 2005.

imageStatus.note: An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
The cash lanes for paying tolls were closed when the NTTA system became all electronic.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.
An additional lane in each direction was opened in October 2021.

images.caption: The Interstate 635 interchange is just ahead.
